summary.title: [AUTOFIX][ISSUE-2581][CANDIDATE-3] Fix overly broad exception handler in run_command
summary.description: Replace bare Exception catch with specific exception types (ValueError, OSError, json.JSONDecodeError) to allow programming errors to propagate.

changes.description: Changed exception handler from catching all Exception to only catching ValueError, OSError, and json.JSONDecodeError. Added json import.
Added two new tests to verify that programming errors (AttributeError, TypeError) propagate instead of being caught.

checks.criteria: Only ValueError, OSError, and json.JSONDecodeError are caught
checks.evidence: Exception handler at cli.py:124 now catches only (ValueError, OSError, json.JSONDecodeError)

checks.criteria: Programming errors (AttributeError, TypeError, NameError, etc.) propagate and crash
checks.evidence: New tests verify AttributeError and TypeError propagate; other programming errors will also propagate

checks.criteria: Error messages to stderr remain the same for caught exceptions
checks.evidence: Exception handling logic unchanged for caught exceptions; existing tests verify error output

risks.description: Any new exception types raised by application code will now cause crashes instead of returning error code 1
risks.mitigation: This is the intended behavior - programming errors should fail fast with full tracebacks for easier debugging
